issue.title: Feature Request: Machine Readable Output

labels.name: v3.x
labels.description: Issues and Pull Requests related to the major version v3

issue.body:
I think it would be beneficial to have a global flag that could render all output as machine readable. 

Initially it would be a nice start if `template` supported it, mostly for my purposes of reading `COMPUTED VALUES` and `USER-SUPPLIED VALUES` as json.

Happy to help here where I can, but not sure if this should first be implemented in helm 2 or just looked at for helm 3. There are lots of differences on where and how things are printed so implementations would likely vary widely. 


Potentially Related Issues: 
- https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/6184 (suggested via slack: #helm-dev)
- https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/6238

body: This should not have been removed. PRs welcome to restore it.
I'm going to work on fixing this

So looking around at the code, I think the output change was very intentional, but it probably was not discussed very well. The `--debug` flag as it stands now actually outputs all the logging and isn't tied to outputting other kinds of data. It seems like the debug flag now has a conflated meaning as it has to do more with additional logging/context and not with the final output of a command. So, my question is whether we want another flag to indicate we want this output or if we should just include it by default? For now I am going to make it work with `--debug`, but wanted to raise this point of conversation

@endzyme Are the original values something you'd want to actually be stored in the release (like in the backing secret)? I would prefer not to because that would start to balloon out the size of the release object (which already get kind of big), so my thinking was to have it be on the object in memory, but not actually write it out to storage. Would that be an ok solution?

@endzyme So I am pretty sure the `Config` data member of a release contains the final merge of the user supplied values based on my initial experimentation. Am I missing something?

EDIT: I think I realized why that was happening. I think you opened this issue before we fixed a bug where the value merge with the chart modified the original vars. That has been fixed

issue.title: fix(cmd): Fix all the outputs

labels.name: size/XL
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 500-999 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: v3.x
labels.description: Issues and Pull Requests related to the major version v3

issue.body:
There were two different methods and varying ways to output the status of a release.
This standardizes all of the outputs, but requires a breaking change. Output will
not perfectly match previous v3 output, and we had to break the printing function
in the `action` package, but now things are much more standardized.

Fixes #6238

body: Thanks for following up - yes - I believe I opened the issue before it was fixed in `dev-v3`. Thanks again!
